summary: This code is a shell script for Linux that checks if the cgroup filesystem is mounted on the system. It uses 'sudo mount' to list all mounted file systems, 'grep -i cgroup' to filter the output for any lines containing "cgroup", and 'awk' to print only the device name, mount point, and target of the cgroup mount point if it exists.
